title.narrative: OEGI- New Ground Water Exploration and Assessment

description.narrative: (Kenya): .USAID's interagency agreement with the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) supports GOK (through remote sensing), mapping, and groundwater modeling to determine the amount of ground water availability in two arid counties of Kenya. USGS will work with local partners to identify sources of information on groundwater; acquire, compile, process, and interpret data. It will also generate preliminary maps for potential groundwater supply; identify gaps and develop plans for research on ground water. It will evaluate conceptual models and methods to interpret remotely sensed data and finalize mapping products; and conduct workshops and training sessions on findings..Poorly-managed water resources and climate variability impact water quantity and quality. While there are adequate water resources in some areas, Kenya is classified among the most water scarce countries in the world. The identification and exploration of Kenya's groundwater resources and the transfer of this information and its use for decision-making is critical in ensuring Kenya's continued access to water. FY 2020 funds will be used to expand the mapping of groundwater resources to additional counties in Kenya, train additional GOK staff on the use of information, and develop a platform for coordination efforts on access and use of groundwater to ensure sustainable access to safe water for drinking... ..The activity advances J2SR by empowering county and national governments as well as their water companies to achieve sustained results by helping them to effectively manage water resources. It also contributes to the US Global Water Strategy Strategic Objective 2 which encourages sound management and protection of freshwater resources. The provision of sustainable access to water and sanitation in Kenya helps to reduce conflict over resources, thus contributing to regional stability..
